definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: The girl who first gets the flower wins the game.
sentences.chinese: 开始荡秋千比赛之前，人们会在高处放一枝花。

sentences.english: He just stood there watching the children riding on the swing.
sentences.chinese: 他只是站在那里看孩子们荡秋千。

sentences.english: In Summer, I want to swing under the grapes stem.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，我想在葡萄架下荡秋千。

sentences.english: I love to play on the swing as well.
I always play on the swing and the slide in my garden.
sentences.chinese: 我总是在花园里面荡秋千，滑滑梯。

sentences.english: Chen Feifei is playing on the swing.
And father Cash also got in on the act, pushing his happy young daughter on the swings.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸卡什也陪着宝贝女儿荡秋千。

sentences.english: The pilot swung the plane into the wind and soon they were in the air.
sentences.chinese: 飞行员像荡秋千似地驾起了飞机，不久就升到了天空。

sentences.english: Fierce wind swings over my green hair, and lightning floats around me.
sentences.chinese: 狂风在我的绿发上荡秋千，闪电在我的周遭萤流。

sentences.english: The monkey jumps to where it can swing.
sentences.chinese: 猴子喜欢跳到可以荡秋千的地方。

definition: swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)
to play rubber band jump rope
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
